intro: Byttneria scalpellata var. asperrima, commonly known as the rough-seeded byttneria, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release seeds. This species is typically found in humid, tropical regions and is adapted to grow in shaded environments.
